definitions.definition: Rearing on both hind legs with the forelegs extended.
definitions.example: The Vienna riding school displays splendid rampant movement.

definitions.definition: Rearing up, especially on its hind leg(s), with a foreleg raised and in profile.
Tilted, said of an arch with one side higher than the other, or a vault whose two abutments are located on an inclined plane.
Unrestrained or unchecked, usually in a negative manner.
definitions.example: Weeds are rampant in any neglected garden.

definitions.definition: Rife, or occurring widely, frequently or menacingly.
definitions.example: There was rampant corruption in the city.
